revised_title: Revisiting the Viscous Behavior of Supercooled Liquids
tldr: The authors studied the viscosities and densities of various aromatic hydrocarbons and esters in the supercooled region. They found that these liquids' viscosities cannot be described by an Arrhenius-type equation but can be represented by a modified Doolittle volume equation. The authors discovered that the onset of aggregation of molecules in the supercooled state affects the viscosity behavior of these liquids. This effect is more apparent as the length of the side group attached to the benzene ring is reduced.
